entry.title: ROSEBURG POLICE CITE MAN FOR DRINKING IN PUBLIC

The man was also issued a city exclusion warning. He was released...

entry.title: UMPQUA VALLEY STEAM HUB WITH STEAM EXTRAVAGANZA
entry.summary: April 8, 2025 3:05 a.m. The Umpqua Valley STEAM Hub will hold a STEAM Extravaganza next month. entry.title: ROSEBURG WITH NEAR RECORD RAINFALL FOR THE DATE ON SUNDAY
entry.summary: April 7, 2025 3:50 a.m. Roseburg had near record rainfall for the date on Sunday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that 0.65 inches of rain was recorded at the Roseburg Regional Airport. That is just below the record amount of rainfall for the date...

entry.title: SUICIDE PREVENTION RESOURCES OFFER SUPPORT THROUGH ADAPT
entry.summary: April 7, 2025 3:30 a.m. Seeing a large increase in suicides in the local community recently, staff with Adapt Integrated Health Care are providing resources. An Adapt release said suicide is a serious public health issue that affects individuals, families and entire communities. 988, the national Suicide and Crisis Lifeline, provides free confidential support 24/7...

entry.title: MARCH 2025 FLOOD PROGRESS REPORT

entry.title: BLM REOPENS ROGUE RIVER TRAIL AFTER LANDSLIDE
entry.summary: April 7, 2025 2:50 a.m. The Bureau of Land Management has reopened the Rogue River National Recreation Trail after crews created a path around a large landslide. entry.title: BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT STARTING SATURDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: April 4, 2025 6:40 a.m. The National Weather Service has issued a Beach Hazards Statement which is in effect from late Saturday night through Sunday afternoon at 5:00 p.m. Forecasters said there is a moderate risk of sneaker waves for all beaches in Douglas and Coos counties. Sneaker waves can run up significantly farther on...
